title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: Today is the fifth anniversary of President Araullo's visionary plan to bring foreign investment to Kronos, a bold act that has reaped tremendous benefits for our fair country.

title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: Today's Abila is a bustling metropolis full of new cars, new construction, gleaming office buildings, and modern conveniences.

title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: Gone are the potholed streets, run-down factories, tired storefronts, and sad marketplaces of the past.

title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: Today's Abila is a city of industry, a place of commerce and investment, a place of opportunity and success.

title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: Prosperity has come to Kronos, and we are all the better for it.

title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: However, there are still those who wrongly think that prosperity is bad for us.

title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: These people claim that foreign investment is bad for our country, that it is diluting our culture and undermining our values.

title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: They claim that the foreigners are exploiting us for their own gain and that our government has little regard for the welfare of our people.

title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: They are so militant in their wrong-headed beliefs that they have fabricated claims that the foreign companies are poisoning our children with their technology.

title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: They have even gone so far as to have brought in foreign "experts" who claim to "have our best interests at heart" to help spread their agenda against progress and prosperity for our people.

title: Kronos Benefits from Foreign Investment
author: Lelio Masin
sentence: The hypocrisy of bringing in foreigners to tell us that opening our country to foreigners is bad for us is ludicrous and is obviously a sign of mental illness in those who oppose our modernization.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: With the third anniversary of Elian Karel's death approaching - former member of the Protectors of Kronos - the question is: who are the protesters?

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: But not only who are they, what and why are they protesting?The Protectors of Kronos or POK were founded in 1997 by residents of rural Elodis on the advice of the now defunct Wellness for All (WFA), an international water safety group.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The POK was initiated to bring attention to the clean water issues surrounding Elodis to the Government of Kronos and the world.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The POK asserts that GAStech International's Tiskele Bend natural gas drilling site is the source of both the contamination of drinking water as well as the destruction of the traditional farmland surrounding Elodis.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: In 1998, WFA performed testing on the water of Elodis finding high levels of benzene, toluene and xylene arsenic, barium, chromium, lead and selenium.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The testing a subsequent statement released by WFA brought international attention and pressure on the government and GAStech to act.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: However, with the fragmenting of WFA due to funding issues, the POK's demands were largely ignored and downplayed.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: Also in 1998, Juliana Vann, a previously healthy ten-year old girl died of a lingering illness, which WFA-funded doctors claimed was caused by water contamination.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The Government of Kronos officially refuted the claim citing the fragmentation of the WFA organization as evidence of an unreliable source not to be trusted.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: Regardless, Juliana became the POK's first martyr and has used Juliana's image on campaign literature ever since.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The POK's second major martyr is Elian Karel, who died in 2009 while incarcerated of undetermined causes.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The POK asserts he was arrested on trumped up charges while the Government of Kronos contends he was a radical and violent activist engaged in tax evasion.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: Karel had been involved with the POK since its inception given that his father, Jeroen Karel, was an original member.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: Elian Karel's death in 2009 was marked by spontaneous instances of protest around Abila.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The anniversary of his death, June 19, has seen additional protests, demonstrations, riots, and violence.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The POK has evolved from peaceful protests and demonstrations demanding government action to more violent activities including riots as they claim that the government has done little to nothing in addressing the contamination, poisonings, and deaths suffered by their people.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: As of 2011, the Government of Kronos has labeled the POK as a "public threat".

title: ELODIS, KRONOS:  A TOWN IN NEED, Part One

sentence: This article is the first installment of a three-part series addressing the growing problem of one community's anguish, government malfeasance, and the alarming influence of multinational corporations on the country of Kronos.

title: ELODIS, KRONOS:  A TOWN IN NEED, Part One
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: ELODIS, Kronos - Nestled in the bend of the Tiskele River, the sun rises over the farming town of Elodis,  chasing away the shadows cloaking nearby Mt. Bouro.

title: ELODIS, KRONOS:  A TOWN IN NEED, Part One
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: Today, as they have every day for over 250 years, residents will rise to tend the rich floodplain land that provides nourishment for the People of Kronos.

title: ELODIS, KRONOS:  A TOWN IN NEED, Part One

sentence: Two weeks prior I received an email from an old friend, Pondo Reese, now the editor of the Elodis Weekly Journal, an agriculture paper serving the community around Tiskele Bend.

title: ELODIS, KRONOS:  A TOWN IN NEED, Part One
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: Established in 1961, the GAStech corporation began as a family-owned business providing local trucking services in Tethys.

title: ELODIS, KRONOS:  A TOWN IN NEED, Part One
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: The two founders - Sten Sanjorge Sr and Hank Fluss - found wildcat drilling to be more lucrative, and thus began a series of environmental disasters and financial scandals that eventually ran Sanjorge Sr into an early grave and drove Fluss into a marginal role in his own company.

title: ELODIS, KRONOS:  A TOWN IN NEED, Part One
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: With the death of Sanjorge Sr, the son took the helm of GAStech firmly in his grasp and broadened its influence further afield, eventually landing at the doorstep of the small peaceful township of Elodis.

title: ELODIS, KRONOS:  A TOWN IN NEED, Part One
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: With a population of 6500, most residents of Elodis live in one- and two-story houses on small farms.

title: ELODIS, KRONOS:  A TOWN IN NEED, Part One

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: ABILA, Kronos - With the third anniversary of Elian Karel's death approaching - former member of the Protectors of Kronos - the question is: who are the protesters?The Protectors of Kronos or POK were founded in 1997 by residents of rural Elodis on the advice of the now defunct Wellness for All (WFA), an international water safety group.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The POK was initiated to bring attention to the clean water issues surrounding Elodis to the Government of Kronos and the world.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The POK asserts that GAStech International's Tiskele Bend natural gas drilling site is the source of both the contamination of drinking water as well as the destruction of the traditional farmland surrounding Elodis.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The POK asserts he was arrested on trumped up charges while the Government of Kronos contends he was a radical and violent activist engaged in tax evasion.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: Karel had been involved with the POK since its inception given that his father, Jeroen Karel, was an original member.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: The POK has evolved from peaceful protests and demonstrations demanding government action to more violent activities including riots as they claim that the government has done little to nothing in addressing the contamination, poisonings, and deaths suffered by their people.

title: WHO ARE THE PROTESTERS
sentence: As of 2011, the Government of Kronos has labeled the POK as a "public threat".

title: A LOOK BACK AT A LIFE CUT TRAGICAL SHORT: ELIAN KAREL
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: Two years ago yesterday Elian Karel died at age 28 in an Abila jail cell, purportedly of cardiac arrest.

title: A LOOK BACK AT A LIFE CUT TRAGICAL SHORT: ELIAN KAREL
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: He had been arrested three months prior for spurious charges of tax evasion and left to linger in a jail cell without further legal action.

title: A LOOK BACK AT A LIFE CUT TRAGICAL SHORT: ELIAN KAREL
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: His attorney, Michale Kraft made several appearances in court demanding that the government outline their specific charges, and release Karel.

title: A LOOK BACK AT A LIFE CUT TRAGICAL SHORT: ELIAN KAREL
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: Kraft had reached an agreement with the government that charges would be reduced and the Karel be released pending a trial, but Karel died two days before he was to go free.

title: A LOOK BACK AT A LIFE CUT TRAGICAL SHORT: ELIAN KAREL
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: Questions linger, however, about the manner of Karel's death.

title: A LOOK BACK AT A LIFE CUT TRAGICAL SHORT: ELIAN KAREL
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: Requests for information were met with assurances that the police -whose custody Karel was in at the time of his death - would do everything possible to perform an exhaustive investigation.

title: A LOOK BACK AT A LIFE CUT TRAGICAL SHORT: ELIAN KAREL
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: This "thorough investigation" lasted all of two weeks, including the time it took the Abila City Coroner to lose the original autopsy files.

title: A LOOK BACK AT A LIFE CUT TRAGICAL SHORT: ELIAN KAREL
author: Petrus Gerhard
sentence: After Karel's body was cremated and sent to his family in Elodis, the Abila Chief of Police closed the case and has declined to answer questions about Karel's death stating that "we are satisfied the death was of natural causes and will no longer be entertaining inquiries.

title: A LOOK BACK AT A LIFE CUT TRAGICAL SHORT: ELIAN KAREL

sentence:
